flawed_nl_solution:
Abe is spending a third of his budget on food, so he spends $3000 / 3 = $<<3000/3=1000.0>>1000.0 on food.
He spends a quarter of his budget on restaurant supplies, so he spends $3000 / 4 = $<<3000/4=705.0>>705.0 on supplies.
Thus, he spends $3000 - $1000.0 - $705.0 = $<<3000-1000.0-705.0=1295.0>>1295.0 on employee wages every month.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 750.0, not 705.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
